availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Drane (Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Wells Drane in Shelby County on November 2, 1825. Father of William C. Drane. Appointed postmaster of Bayard in Shelby County on March 5, 1838. Farmer in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 198.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #000259284.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, p. 434 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "James H. Drane (March 31, 1805-October 23, 1892)," Memorial #8207894, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8207894 (accessed August 2, 2018).
